thread.title: Workington Town chair hails 'transformational' Fibrus partnership - Yahoo News UK
thread.title_full: Workington Town chair hails 'transformational' Fibrus partnership - Yahoo News UK

author: Andrew Cunningham
title: Workington Town chair hails 'transformational' Fibrus partnership - Yahoo News UK
text:
Workington Town chair hails 'transformational' Fibrus partnership Andrew Cunningham Thu 27 November 2025 at 5:00 am UTC 3 min read
Under the sponsorship, Workington Town has expanded its community programmes and grown beyond the men’s first team (Image: Tom Kay) The chairman of Workington Town has praised Fibrus Broadband's sponsorship as 'transformational' in aiding the club's recent growth.
Graeme Peers says the support of Fibrus has been 'instrumental' during the last three years.
The broadband provider has renewed its main sponsorship for another 12 months, extending support through to October 2026.
The broadband provider has renewed its main sponsorship for another 12 months (Image: Tom Kay)
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Mr Peers said: "It’s an excellent working partnership with Fibrus.
"It started with an enquiry from a Fibrus staff member and evolved into sponsorship of the men’s and ladies’ kits, and support for the general infrastructure of the club.
"We’re really appreciative of the support.
"It’s been a proper step change in how the club has recovered since 2022.
The chairman credited Fibrus with helping the club weather difficult financial periods (Image: Tom Kay)
"We're just in a much stronger position."
Under the sponsorship, Workington Town has expanded its community programmes and grown beyond the men’s first team.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement The club now includes a women’s rugby league team, a women’s football team, netball squads, and full junior pathways from age five.
Mr Peers said: "We’re in a position where we can invest in things.
"The return on that investment has been tenfold.
"All our wider revenues are up."
He credited Fibrus with helping the club weather difficult financial periods.
He said: "There were some tricky financial times in early 2022 before they came on board.
"Their support allowed us to recover quickly.
The club has unveiled its kit for the 2026 season—a retro design inspired by the 1993/94 strip (Image: Tom Kay)
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement "We wouldn’t have been where we were in the league table last year without them."
Workington Town finished second last season but missed out on the title.
Following restructuring by the Rugby Football League, the club now competes in a new 21-team division.
Mr Peers said: "We see ourselves as a middle-band club.
"The aim is to push towards the top ten and the play-offs.
Workington Town finished second last season but missed out on the title (Image: Tom Kay)
"We’ve recruited a squad to do that."
The club has also unveiled its kit for the 2026 season—a retro design inspired by the 1993/94 strip, when Town won the Second Division Championship and Divisional Premiership.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Fibrus representatives joined players at Derwent Park on Saturday to celebrate the sponsorship renewal and view the new kit.
Craig Middlemiss, delivery manager at Fibrus, said: "Being both a delivery manager at Fibrus and a passionate Workington Town fan, I'm proud that we're supporting the club again this year.
The chairman said the support of Fibrus had been 'instrumental' during the last three years (Image: Tom Kay)
"I'm really pleased to see our company getting behind the club."
Colin Hutchinson, managing director of Fibrus, said: "When we began our sponsorship of Workington Town we were hopeful of a lasting, mutually beneficial partnership and it has proved to be exactly that.
Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement Advertisement "We are delighted to be renewing our support for another year and are excited to watch Town make more progress next season in the new league structure."
Workington Town players will be meeting fans this Saturday.
Town and Fibrus will have a stall at the Workington Christmas Lights Switch On with new shirts and giveaways for fans.
